page.title: 12Farming 6 - Long Barn Farm
page.content: This practices mixed arable and dairy farming. It has 225 acres. Stock consists of milking cows, heifers, sheep, lambs, calves, chickens and one beef bull. Crops grown are wheat, barley, oats, kale, potatoes and grass for grazing. Machinery consists for 3 tractors and harvesters. A cow gives around 5000 litres of milk in 305 days. Cows weigh between 500 and 600 kilos. Most calves are raised rather than bought. All cows are British freisians and are milked in a parlour. In addition to the fodder crops grown, cattle cake is fed in the winter. The cows are kept in the sheds in the winter. There are 150 sheep used for wool and meat, 4 sheep dogs and 1 pony.
